snippet: The comments by Leung Chun-ying, the territory’s chief executive, did little to clarify whether Hong Kong would allow all adults to vote in the next election.
abstract: Chief executive of Hong Kong, Leung Chun-ying, calls for greater government spending on education from kindergarten through college in his annual policy address, but says little in response to appeals here for greater democracy and does not clarify whether Hong Kong would allow all adults to vote in next election.
lead_paragraph: The comments by Leung Chun-ying, the territory’s chief executive, did little to clarify whether Hong Kong would allow all adults to vote in the next election.

headline.main: Hong Kong Leader’s Speech Skirts Appeals for Democracy
headline.print_headline: Hong Kong Leader’s Speech Skirts Appeals for Democracy
